alert.note: Alert for Idaho Palouse (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 01 at 3:20PM MST until January 03 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...LOCALIZED BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW SATURDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY AND ANOTHER ROUND OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY... .Increasingly gusty south winds will cause drifting snow across the Palouse, Camas Prairie, and Pomeroy area tonight, Sunday and into Monday. Snow that is on the ground now, may blow some roads shut and possibly cause significant visibility reductions. Our next round of moderate to locally heavy snow will develop over the Cascades Sunday evening and spread into northeast Washington and north Idaho by Monday morning. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 4 PM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Drifting snow expected. South winds of 10 to 20 mph with gusts to 35 mph expected. * WHERE...Potlatch, Rosalia, Clarkston, Plummer, Pomeroy, Colfax, Tekoa, Moscow, Genesee, Alpowa Summit, Uniontown, La Crosse, Pullman, and Oakesdale. * WHEN...From Midnight tonight to 4 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Some roads over southeast Washington and the Palouse may be blown shut. Do not attempt to drive on roads that have been closed by local authorities.
info.instruction: If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution and be prepared for sudden changes in visibility. Allow extra time to reach your destination. Make sure your car is winterized and in good working order.
